intro: Acer mono var. connivens, commonly known as the Chinese maple, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in the fall. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged samaras for seed dispersal. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and parks.
